Docs.summary: Parses or builds an SDP as defined by RFC 2327. Note: All public static members of this type are thread-safe. All instance members are not guaranteed to be thread-safe.

Docs.summary: Gets the approximate amount of space required (in characters) to serialize the SDP.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] GetBytes() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an array of bytes containing a valid SDP that is ready to be transmitted. This function calls Write() and then converts the result to an array of bytes using the UTF-8 character set.
Docs.returns: Returns SDP as a new instance of a byte array.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the SDP cannot be composed in its current state.

Docs.summary: Gets the GlobalDescription associated with this SDP.

Docs.summary: Gets the line number within the SDP where the error was detected. Line numbers start at 1.

Docs.summary: Gets a detailed message describing why the SDP could not be parsed upon failure.

Thrown when null is passed as an argument.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Parse (ArraySegment<byte> segment, bool strict);
.method public hidebysig instance void Parse(valuetype System.ArraySegment`1<unsigned int8> segment, bool strict) cil managed
Public Sub Parse (segment As ArraySegment(Of Byte), strict As Boolean)
public: void Parse(ArraySegment<System::Byte> segment, bool strict);

Docs.param: The array segment containing the SDP to parse.

A value of true indicates the SDP parser should strictly enforce the SDP encoding rules. It is recommended that strict parsing is always used, however being more lenient may be useful there is a need to communicate with a noncompliant device.
Docs.summary: Parses the supplied array segment into data structures representing the components of the SDP.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the provided SDP is malformated. See exception message for details.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed
Public Overrides Function ToString () As String

Docs.summary: Creates a string containing a valid SDP that is ready to be transmitted. This function calls Write() and then converts the result to a string.
Docs.returns: Returns the SDP as a new instance of a string.

remarks.para: Returns the class name string if unable to compose a valid SDP string.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TryParse(valuetype System.ArraySegment`1<unsigned int8> segment) cil managed
Public Function TryParse (segment As ArraySegment(Of Byte)) As Boolean

Docs.param: The array segment of bytes containing the SDP to parse.
Docs.summary: Parses the supplied array segment of bytes as an SDP. Returns true if the SDP is valid.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the array contained a valid SDP. If false is returned, then LastParseErrorMessage and LastParseErrorLineNumber provide information about why the SDP could not be parsed.
Docs.exception: An attempt to parse more than one text was made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TryParse(unsigned int8[] bytes) cil managed
Public Function TryParse (bytes As Byte()) As Boolean

Docs.param: The array of bytes containing the SDP to parse.
Docs.summary: Parses the supplied array of bytes as an SDP. Returns true if the SDP is valid.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the array contained a valid SDP. If false is returned, then LastParseErrorMessage and LastParseErrorLineNumber provide information about why the SDP could not be parsed.
Docs.exception: Thrown when null is passed as an argument.
An attempt to parse more than one text was made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TryParse(string sdpText) cil managed
Public Function TryParse (sdpText As String) As Boolean

Docs.param: The string containing the SDP to parse.
Docs.summary: Parses the supplied string. This function will convert the string to an array of UTF8 encoded bytes and then call the TryParse() function with an array of bytes.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the string contained a valid SDP. If false is returned, then LastParseErrorMessage and LastParseErrorLineNumber provide information about why the SDP could not be parsed.
Docs.exception: Thrown when null is passed as an argument.
Thrown when empty string is passed as an argument.
An attempt to parse more than one text was made.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool TryParse (byte[] rawSdp, int offset, int count, bool strict);
.method public hidebysig instance bool TryParse(unsigned int8[] rawSdp, int32 offset, int32 count, bool strict) cil managed
Public Function TryParse (rawSdp As Byte(), offset As Integer, count As Integer, strict As Boolean) As Boolean
public: bool TryParse(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ rawSdp, int offset, int count, bool strict);
member this.TryParse : byte[] * int * int * bool -> bool

Docs.param: The array of bytes containing the SDP to parse.
The offset into the byte array where parsing should begin.
The number of bytes in the array to parse.

A value of true indicates the SDP parser should strictly enforce the SDP encoding rules. It is recommended that strict parsing is always used, however being more lenient may be useful there is a need to communicate with a noncompliant device.
Docs.summary: Parses the supplied array of bytes as an SDP. Returns true if the SDP is valid.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the array contains a valid SDP. If false is returned, then LastParseErrorMessage and LastParseErrorLineNumber provide information about why the SDP could not be parsed.
Docs.exception: Thrown when offset and count are not within range of the supplied array.
An attempt to parse more than one text was made.

Docs.summary: Creates a string containing a valid SDP that is ready to be transmitted.
Docs.exception: Thrown when the SDP cannot be composed in its current state.
